er.corebl.mail

Enum ERCMailer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<ERCMailer>
      • er.corebl.mail.ERCMailer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ERCMailer>

    public enum ERCMailer
extends java.lang.Enum<ERCMailer>
    The ERCMailer is a singleton to send mail messages at a specified send rate. Since the send rate is maintained in the executing process, the mailer should only be running on a single instance.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  ERCMailer.MailerCallback
      A MailerCallback allows for pre/post processing.
      static interface  ERCMailer.MailerDelegate
      A MailerDelegate allows for message suppression and modification that is beyond the scope of the mailer daemon.
      private static class  ERCMailer.MessageSender
      The Message sender class sends messages on a background thread.

      • setMailerDelegate

        public void setMailerDelegate(ERCMailer.MailerDelegate delegate)
        Sets the MailerDelegate for the mailer. The default delegate just uses the logic in the SingleSenderDelegate class. If you need to modify messages before sending them for CAN SPAM Act compliance, have a look at the CSAMailerDelegate class.
        Parameters:
        delegate - the mailer delegate to set

      • sendMailMessage

        private void sendMailMessage(er.javamail.ERMailDelivery delivery,
                   long wait)
        This method serves as a bottleneck for rate limited sending when 'wait' is greater than 0.
        Parameters:
        delivery - the mail delivery to send
        wait - the wait time in milliseconds
